Subject: No convergence and strange warning message
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=211891685; y=44Gfp_98o66FsPd55NVFCzZmMCZ_OaO6_o02JAAI6pHo-Hz_gA
X-Yahoo-Profile: csmnofbobs

Dear Dave,
My name is Jeff Miller, and I am a student at the Colorado School of 
Mines.  I am using the equilibrium Matlab demo to determine the 
temperature of a mixture of N2O and C2H6 after the mixture has 
reacted to equilibrium.  In addition to getting the "no convergence 
after 1000 iterations" message, it returns the following warning:

Warning:Temperature (3006.05 K) outside valid range of 300 K to 3000 K
Warning:Temperature (3036.15 K) outside valid range of 300 K to 3000 K

I am still learning to use Cantera, so I am just using the data in 
gri30.cti.  The data for C2H6 uses the temperature ranges 200-1000K 
and 1000-3500K, and the data for N2O uses the ranges 200-1000K and 
1000-6000K.  Why does it say that the valid temperature range is only 
from 300-3000K?  Is this also why there is no solution after 1000 
iterations?  Is there some way to change what the valid temperature 
range is, as well as a way to increase the number of iterations?  
Thank you very much, and I look forward to attending your seminar 
here at Mines later this month.

Jeff Miller
